subject: Nutrition
title: The Obesity Epidemic
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Obesity Epidemic.

hook.text: In 1960, 13% of Americans were obese. Today it's over 40%. The food changed more than people did.

buildup.text: Calorie availability in the U.S. increased by 500 calories per person per day between 1970 and 2000.

discovery.text: Ultra-processed foods now make up 60% of calories. They're engineered to override fullness signals.

twist.text: Obesity rates track with processed food adoption, not with changes in exercise levels.

climax.text: Every country that adopts a Western processed diet sees obesity follow within a single generation.

punchline.text: The food supply changed. Our biology didn't.

quiz.question: What is the current U.S. obesity rate?
